ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automated code generation and modification based on natural language prompts.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Manage code files and folders â€¢ Create and edit code on command â€¢ Store code in short-term memory â€¢ Review code changes â€¢ Run code files
ðŸ“– Summary: Devseeker is a CLI coding agent that automates code creation, modification, and management. It allows users to generate new projects or improve existing codebases using natural language prompts. Devseeker supports multiple coding modes, various AI models, and provides features like code review, token usage calculation, and short-term memory for code storage.

ðŸš€ Starguard | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Automated open-source due diligence for CTOs, security teams, and investors.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Detects fake-star campaigns â€¢ Identifies dependency hijacks â€¢ Flags high-risk licenses â€¢ Analyzes contributor activity â€¢ Scans for code obfuscation and malicious patterns
ðŸ“– Summary: StarGuard is a CLI tool designed to assess the risk associated with GitHub repositories. It automates open-source due diligence by detecting fake stars, dependency vulnerabilities, license issues, and other red flags. StarGuard provides trust scores and reports to help users quickly evaluate the safety and reliability of open-source projects.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ apkurlgrep | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Extracting endpoints from APK files for security analysis and pentesting.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Extracts URLs from APK files â€¢ Extracts URL paths from APK files
ðŸ“– Summary: ApkUrlGrep is a Go-based tool designed to extract URLs and URL paths from APK files. It aids security researchers and penetration testers in identifying potential endpoints within Android applications. The tool simplifies the process of uncovering hidden URLs, facilitating security assessments.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ Noi | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: AI-enhanced, customizable browser designed to streamline digital experience by integrating and managing multiple AI services.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ AI Support for multiple models (ChatGPT, Claude, Gemini, Grok, DeepSeek, GitHub Copilot, HuggingChat) â€¢ Customizable browser with the ability to add any URL â€¢ Prompts Management (add, sync, batch tag, remove)
ðŸ“– Summary: Noi is a JavaScript-based application that functions as an AI-enhanced browser, allowing users to integrate and manage various AI services like ChatGPT, Claude, and Gemini. It offers features such as customizable prompts, batch messaging to multiple AI chats, theming options, a cache mode for quick swapping of links, and cookie data isolation for using multiple accounts on the same website.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ plane | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Open-source project management for tracking issues, epics, and cycles.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Issues tracking and management with rich text editor and sub-properties â€¢ Cycles for sprint tracking with burn-down charts â€¢ Modules for dividing projects into smaller parts â€¢ Customizable views with filters â€¢ Pages for capturing and organizing ideas with AI capabilities
ðŸ“– Summary: Plane is an open-source project management tool designed as an alternative to Jira, Linear, Monday, and Asana. It helps teams track issues, manage sprints (cycles), and organize product roadmaps. Key features include issue tracking, cycle management, modular project breakdown, customizable views, and AI-powered pages for idea capture.

âœ¨ Checkmate | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Real-time monitoring of server hardware, uptime, response times, and incidents.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Server hardware monitoring â€¢ Uptime tracking â€¢ Response time monitoring â€¢ Incident tracking â€¢ Real-time alerts and reports
ðŸ“– Summary: Checkmate is an open-source, self-hosted tool for monitoring server infrastructure. It tracks server hardware, uptime, response times, and incidents in real-time, providing alerts and visualizations. An optional agent, Capture, provides additional insights into server CPU, RAM, disk, and temperature status.
